HYI.F.summary: Hyrican Informationssysteme Aktiengesellschaft offers IT systems and solutions in Germany and internationally. The company provides PCs, notebooks, servers, workstations, and peripherals. It also offers gaming systems; and supplies hardware products. In addition, the company provides IT solutions, including mobility technologies, cloud computing, and data center solutions; and client management, server and storage, IT security, networking, software, and communication solutions, as well as managed, professional, and training services. Further, it offers business to business solutions for public sector, education sector, industries, and companies. Hyrican Informationssysteme Aktiengesellschaft was founded in 1990 and is headquartered in KindelbrÃ¼ck, Germany.

MT3.HM.summary: Matica Technologies AG develops, manufactures, and distributes solutions to issue passports, financial cards, ID cards, and Nano and micro SIM cards worldwide. The company offers direct to card ID printers, retransfer printers and laminators, laser engraving systems, and passport printers; desktop solutions, such as metal plate embossers, credit and debit cards issuance systems, prepackaged desktop systems, and industrial desktop systems for low and mid-volume issuance programs; kiosk card printers; mid-range and mailing systems; and centralized issuance and mailing systems under the Matica brand name. Its products are used in financial, government, corporate, education, transit/transportation, health care/insurance, retail, telecommunication, and entertainment/clubs/hotel applications. The company has a strategic partnership with Canon Finetech Nisca Inc. for the development of Matica EDIsecure MC660, a 600dpi card printer for security applications. Matica Technologies AG was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Munich, Germany. Matica Technologies AG is a subsidiary of Matica System S.p.A.

NXR.DE.summary: NeXR Technologies SE provides digital products and services in the B2B area. The company operates through 3D Instagraph, VRIDAY, and OnPoint Studios. Its 3D Instagraph business unit develops and produces complex 3D photogrammetry scanner systems which is used by video game providers, film studios, social networks, e-learning, the clothing industry, and 3D character printing. The company's VRIDAY business unit, an agency service provider, develops and produces digital virtual reality applications for companies, such as sports, music, and entertainment industries. Its OnPoint business unit offers services related to motion capture and animation. The company was formerly known as Staramba SE and changed its name to NEXR Technologies SE in September 2019. NEXR Technologies SE is headquartered in Berlin, Germany. NEXR Technologies SE is a subsidiary of Hevella Capital GmbH & Co. KGaA.

NXR.F.summary: NeXR Technologies SE provides digital products and services in the B2B area. The company operates through 3D Instagraph, VRIDAY, and OnPoint Studios. Its 3D Instagraph business unit develops and produces complex 3D photogrammetry scanner systems which is used by video game providers, film studios, social networks, e-learning, the clothing industry, and 3D character printing. The company's VRIDAY business unit, an agency service provider, develops and produces digital virtual reality applications for companies, such as sports, music, and entertainment industries. Its OnPoint business unit offers services related to motion capture and animation. The company was formerly known as Staramba SE and changed its name to NEXR Technologies SE in September 2019. NEXR Technologies SE is headquartered in Berlin, Germany. NEXR Technologies SE is a subsidiary of Hevella Capital GmbH & Co. KGaA.

TTC.HM.summary: transtec AG provides IT systems in Europe. The company offers personal computers (PCs), such as business tablets, all-in-one PCs, mini PCs, compact PCs, and silent PCs, as well as PCs for office, medical, and industrial use; workstations; and application, silent, infrastructure, datacenter, and virtualization servers. It also provides storage products; backup systems; network products, including unmanaged switches, managed switches, LAN switches, FC switches, InfiniBand switches, firewall systems, network adapters, and IoT gateways; and software solutions for data center infrastructure, such as virtualization, backup, virus protection, etc. In addition, the company offers high performance computing (HPC) solutions to calculate and simulate processes, and analyze measurement data. Its HPC solutions are used in meteorology, climatology, astro and particle physics, systems biology, genetics, and quantum chemistry or fluid mechanics areas. Further, the company provides customized systems and appliances. transtec AG was founded in 1980 and is based in Reutlingen, Germany.

TUR.F.summary: Turbon AG produces and distributes writing printing accessories. It operates through two segments, Turbon Printing and Turbon Electric. The company also develops and manufactures electrical and electronic assemblies and equipment. It has operations in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The company is based in Hattingen, Germany. Turbon AG is a subsidiary of Hbt Holdings Gmbh.

VJET.summary: voxeljet AG provides three-dimensional (3D) printers and on-demand parts services to industrial and commercial customers in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Asia Pacific, and the Americas. It operates in two segments, Systems and Services. The Systems segment develops, manufactures, and sells 3D printers. This segment also offers consumables, including particulate materials and proprietary chemical binding agents, maintenance contracts, and spare parts. The Services segment prints on-demand parts for its customers, as well as creates parts, molds, cores, and models using 3D computer-aided design at its service center; and provides casting services. It serves automotive, aerospace, art and architecture, engineering, and consumer product end markets; foundries and suppliers; and universities and research institutes through its direct sales force and a network of sales agents. The company was formerly known as Voxeljet Technology GmbH and changed its name to voxeljet AG in January 2004. voxeljet AG was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Friedberg, Germany.

It operates in two segments, Systems and Services. The Systems segment develops, manufactures, and sells 3D printers. The Services segment prints on-demand parts for its customers, as well as creates parts, molds, cores, and models using 3D computer-aided design at its service center; and provides casting services. It serves automotive, aerospace, art and architecture, engineering, and consumer product end markets; foundries and suppliers; and universities and research institutes through its direct sales force and a network of sales agents. The company was formerly known as Voxeljet Technology GmbH and changed its name to voxeljet AG in January 2004. voxeljet AG was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Friedberg, Germany.
